Authors:
Shun Liu, Lulu Shen, Tai Min Xu, Genevieve Gates, Bao-Kai
Cui
Title:
Species diversity and molecular phylogeny of Cyanosporus
(Polyporales, Basidiomycota)
Keywords:
Brown-rot fungi, Fomitopsidaceae, Multi-gene phylogeny,
Phylogeny, Taxonomy
Abstract:
Cyanosporus is a cosmopolitan brown-rot genus,
recognizable for blue-tinted basidiocarps. Taxonomic and phylogenetic
studies on Cyanosporus was carried out. On the basis of DNA sequences of
multiple loci including the internal transcribed spacer (ITS) regions,
the large subunit nuclear ribosomal RNA gene (nLSU), the small subunit
nuclear ribosomal RNA gene (nSSU), the small subunit mitochondrial rRNA
gene sequences (mtSSU), the RNA polymerase II largest subunit (RPB1),
the second largest subunit (RPB2) genes and the translation elongation
factor 1-a gene (TEF), five new species, Cyanosporus bubalinus sp. nov.,
C. hirsutus sp. nov., C. nothofagicola sp. nov., C. submicroporus sp.
nov., C. tenuis sp. nov., and fifteen new combinations, C. arbuti comb.
nov., C. auricoma comb. nov., C. bifaria comb. nov., C. caesiosimulans
comb. nov., C. coeruleivirens comb. nov., C. comata comb. nov., C.
cyanescens comb. nov., C. glauca comb. nov., C. gossypina comb. nov., C.
livens comb. nov., C. magna comb. nov., C. populi comb. nov., C.
simulans comb. nov., C. subviridis comb. nov., C. yanae comb. nov., are
proposed. Illustrated descriptions of the novel species are
provided.
